techmeme.title: US v. Google: DuckDuckGo CEO Gabriel Weinberg testifies that Chrome is worth "upwards of $50B if it went on the market" based on "back-of-the-envelope" math (Bloomberg)
Ofcom outlines 40+ child safety measures for websites and apps to introduce from July 2025 or face large fines under the Online Safety Act, including age checks (Dan Milmo/The Guardian)
LinkedIn expands its free verification system to the wider web, letting sites display LinkedIn verification, starting with Adobe's new Content Authenticity app (Dominic Preston/The Verge)
Adobe unveils its Firefly Image Model 4 and Model 4 Ultra, launches a redesigned Firefly web app, is testing a new Adobe Content Authenticity web app, and more (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
Revolut reports 2024 revenue up 72% YoY to £3.1B, net profit up 149% YoY to £1.1B, and wealth unit revenue up 298% YoY to £506M; its loan book grew 86% to £979M (Ryan Browne/CNBC)
